result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody L. Cromwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).
  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).
  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence previously imposed

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Recalled 3:13.   Conference regarding jury instructions.  Jury in @ 3:35.  Dr. Schoenecker retakes stand.  No cross.  Wns excused.  Evidence closed.  Court reads jury instructions.  Closing by Cody Cromwell.  Closing by State.  Jury excused to deliberate @ 3:52.  Recalled 4:06.  Jury in @ 4:10.   Court reads verdict... in regards to 14CF318: Ct. 1 --no mental defect, Ct. 2 --no mental defect, Ct. 3 --no mental defect; 14CF319  --no mental defect;  15CF74 --no mental defect.  Court polls the jury.  Jury excused @ 4:18.  State moves for judgment; granted  Sentening hearing to be scheduled.

14CF318, 14CF319, 15CF74: Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Jury Trial Day 2; discussion on security issues; review of jury instructions; recess; 9:13 reconviene; State heard re: Dr. Schoenecker; 9:21 Jury led in; Court heard; Court reviews jury instructions; State closing statement; Def. makes closing statement; State rebuttal; Court gives final jury instructions; juror excused; bailiffs sworn; 10:11 Jury led out to deliberate; discussion on exhibits that may be allowed to jurors - all photos; discussion on phase 2 process/need; 10:20 recess; 10:35 reconviene; 10:42 jury led in for verdict; (10:44) 14CF318 - Court 1: Guilty, Count 2: Guilty; Count 3: Guilty; 14CF319: Guilty; 15CF74: Guilty; State requests polling; Court polls jury; 10:55 jury led out; discussion on process for Phase 2, Def. heard; 11:01 jury led in; Court reviews instructions for Phase 2; Def. statement; State opening statement; Def. calls Dr. Craig Schoenecker, s/t; 11:48 jury led out; State heard on issue of cross examination; Court will not allow Def. to call DA's staff as witness (Victim/witness coordinator); further discussion; State will be allowed to cross Dr.; State will defer examination of Dr.; Dr. steps down; 12:00 recess; 1:01 reconviene; Def. called and sworn; 1:04 jury led in; Def. testifies; 1:33 jury led out; witness excused; no further witnesses; State moves for directed verdict; Court denies; 1:38 jury led in; Defense rests; State calls Dr. Craig Schoenecker, s/t; jury led out 2:58; witness excused; recess at 2:59
1 - 14 (Ex 5 is unable to be scanned; Ex 14 is confidential report filed/scanned 9/21/15)

(8:31) (14CF318, 14CF319 & 15CF74) Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant; defendant wants to plea; State heard; discussion held; Court heard regarding copy of exhibits; Court questions defendant and review plea questionnaire; defendant does not change his plea; Court finds def has previously waive right to counsel; State heard; Court finds def competent to proceed to trial; defendant wishes to proceed in prison clothing; defendant heard; State responds; discussion held regarding restraints; Court heard on how the trial shall proceed; 9:12 jury pool brought in; Court addresses jury; jury panel sworn; voir dire; 10:15 jury selected/sworn; Court addresses and releases remaining jury pool; Court heard; 10:24 jury taken out; Court heard on sidebar & def's behavior; discussion held restraints and how trial will proceed; 10:40 recess; 1053 jury brought in/reconvene; Court gives opening instructions; State gives opening; defendant gives opening; State calls Kurt Berkovitz, sworn & testifies; witness ID's defendant; State call Andrew Londos, sworn & testifies; witness ID's defendant; sidebar; defendant resumes cross; 12:00 jury taken out/recess; 1:01 jury brought in/reconvene; State's redirect of  witness Andrew Londos; State calls Registrar Correne Giebel, sworn & testies; witness ID's defendant; State calls CO Tracy Kappell, sworn & testifes; witness ID's def; State calls CO Nicholas Sanchez, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; State calls CO Andrew Moungey, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; 2:09 jury taken out; State heard on defendant's line of questioning; 2:22 jury brought back; defendant con't cross of witness Mongey; State call CO Andrew Larson, sworn & testifies; witness ID's def; State rests; 2:47 jury taken out; Court questions defendant & reviews rights; discussion held; 3:03 recess; 3:15 reconvene; Court questions defendant; defendant intends to testify; def is sworn; 3:19 jury brought in; Court heard; defendant testifies; 3:42 jury taken out; discussion held; defendant rests; 3:50 jury brought in; Court informs jury that the defense has rested; Court heard and jury is released for the evening; 3:53 jury excused for the day; jury instruction conference; Court heard; 4:00 recess until 8:15 am

14CF318, 14CF319 and 15CF74.  State of Wisconsin apprs in person by Atty Kurt Klomberg.  DEF, Cody Cromwell apprs in person; in custody w/o coun.   DEF heard on not finding coun yet.  State objects to any movement of scheduled jury trial.  Court reviews previous Attys DEF had/reviews history of cases.  Court offers DEF if Public Defender should be contacted by phone.  DEF rejects.  Court finds DEF rejects coun and is competent to continue Pro Se.  State heard/states DEF is aware on proceedings of a jury trial.  Courts aware.  Court orders jury trial to remain scheduled.  DEF offered opportunity to wear street clothes.

Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. (14CF318 & 319, 15CF74) Court questions defendant and reviews chgs and pens; NGI plea is withdrawan; discussion held; defendant notes not happy with representation; parties heard and request hearing to end and matter to remain on the trial calendar; recess; Matter reconvenes with same previous appearances and now Atty Moeller(by phone) and Atty Button appear for the SPD office; discussion held regarding def's representation; Atty Ksicinski moves to withdraw; motion for withdrawal is granted; parties heard; Court heard; defendant to hire counsel by next hearing or accept SPD appointment;  Review hearing scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.

(14CF318, 14CF319 & 15CF74) Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Will do motion for joinder and motions in limine, date set for P&S 11/25/15 at 3pm if needed; 1:38pm Def. brought in; Atty. Ksicinski heard - has spoken with client and reviewed State's offer and the motions to be heard today; State heard on motion for joinder; Atty. Ksincinski heard and notes no objection; Court grants motion for joinder; Atty. Ksincinski speaks to Def. and Def. notes that he agrees; State will draft order; State moves to motions in limine, except for #9 and heard on reasons for same being held open; Motions in limine #1 - stipulated; State heard on MIL #11 - no doctor reports coming in for first phase, Atty. Ksincinski heard on same; motion granted in #11; State heard on other motions - rec't before first of the  year; discussion on outstanding discovery - Atty. Ksincinski heard on doctor testimony/reports from prior cases - State notes that same should be obtained from the Clerk of Courts/Court Reporter and if need authorization for release of same, State will sign; Court will allow Atty. Ksicinski to obtain copies of whatever is needed out of Def.'s other cases; notices of P&S handed out; State will draft proposed orders; Def. remanded
Order for Examination under 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) - order for Dr. Schoenecker
emails regarding release of inmate information

Telephone scheduling conference at 09-15-2015 08:00 am.
Motion hearing at 10-01-2015 01:00 pm.
Jury trial at 01-26-2016 08:30 am.

14CF318, 14CF319 & 15CF74 - 
Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody with attorney Syovata Kanini Edari.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Det. Stiemsma. Atty Edari filed for withdraw of counsel and substitution on all 3 cases called - Atty Paul Ksicinski here, prepared to proceed and substitute in as counsel. DA Klomberg heard - objects to both withdraw and substitution. Court heard; finds grants motion to withdraw and substitution of counsel - appoints Atty Paul Ksicinski. Court takes short recess to allow DA to speak with new counsel.

Cases recalled. Appearances same. Parties prepared to proceed with competency. Court takes recess to allow Atty Ksicinski to speak with client regarding reports.

Cases recalled. Appearances same. Mr. Cromwell questioned by Court; Mr. Cromwell wishes to proceed. Dr Reports marked/Exhibit List prepared. Atty Ksicinski requests sequestration. Discussion held. Court overrules sequestration of doctors. Atty Ksicinski withdraws request. Dr. David Thompson s/t. Dr. excused. Parties request short recess.

Cases recalled. Appearances same. Dr. Craig Schoenecker, s/t. State rests. Atty Ksicinski heard; DA Klomberg heard. Court will not accept the offer of proof.  Court will not go into any inquire that would allow directly or indirectly what would go into confidental information.  Court recesses for 15 Minutes.

Case recalled. Appearances same. Defendant Cody Cromwell will not testify. Court turns Mr. Cromwells microphone off. DA Klomberg wants defendant to be found competent.  Attorney Ksicinski makes record that he feels defendant is not competent.  Discussion held. Court heard and finds testimony of both doctors credible and reliable; does have ability to understand proceedings and assist counsel; Court finds competent to proceed. Parties proceed to prelim after break.

Case recalled. Appearances same. Court proceeds to Preliminary on all 3 cases. Det. Stiemsma s/t. Parties heard. Court heard and binds over on all 3 cases to trial. Parties proceed to arraignment. DA Klomberg files Information in all 3 cases. Review of info is waived; not guilty/NGI plea entered; DA Klomberg requests Dr. Schoenecker; Atty Ksicinski requests Dr. Rawski from WI Forensic Unit. Court appoints Dr. Rawski. Discovery requested. Court schedules.
to withdraw and substitution of court appointed counsel
Competency hearing on July 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.
for updated comp eval from Dr Schoenecker
for Competency Examination by DHS - 2nd opinion
Telephone scheduling conference on May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

(14CF318 & 319 and 15CF74) Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody with attorney Syovata Kanini Edari.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court will appoint Dr. David Thompson to perform a 2nd comp eval in 14CF318 & 319 and Dr Schoenecker will update his report; Atty Edari accepts appointment on 15CF74; competency is raised in 15CF74 and that shall be added to Dr. Thompson's order;  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Document: Proposed Order - WRIT (March 20, 2015) - Change In Time Filed by: Robert G. Barrington Reason: printed copy signed
Competency hearing on March 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on March 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

(14CF318 & 14CF319) Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody with attorney Syovata Kanini Edari.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held on competency; Court will toll the time limits for cause and orders a competency evaluations;
Preliminary hearing on December 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

14CF318 & 319 - ADA Barrington appears for State. Def FTA. Court heard on case status and hearing that occurred yesterday. Defendant found incompetent to represent self however competent to proceed with cases. Atty Vollan heard; attempted to process eligibility forms to have counsel, defendant refused same. Court heard finds cause to proceed with cases, cannot proceed today with Prelim; given findings in branch 1 and his refusal of SPD, Court will appoint Atty Edari on 14CF318 & 319. SPD will re-appoint on remaining case. Atty Westrick is still on case as stated yesterday. Discussion as to scheduling. Court reschedules Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

12CF393, 13CF391, 14CF318 & 14CF319 - Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in custody, via video from DCI with attorney David Robert Westrick in person (on 12CF393 & 13CF391).  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Westrick heard; moves to withdraw from cases per request of defendant. DA Klomberg heard; objects to withdraw of counsel. Defendant heard. Discussion held. Court heard and ordres in regards to 12CF393 case, motion denied; in regards to 13CF391 grants request to withdraw and SPD will appoint new counsel. Court releases Atty Westrick to leave. Court heard; questions defendant regarding representation in 13CF391. Defendant states does not want any representation in any of his cases. Court heard and directs SPD appoint counsel regarding these cases; is not able to proceed on his own behalf as previously shown in JT in this court. Court has Atty Vollan from SPD on the phone; explains status of cases and need for appointment of counsel. Discussion held. Atty Vollan heard; will appoint counsel as ordered by Court. Court heard; will leave on for PH tomorrow as set and as set in other cases. Court has discussion with defendant; explains need for counsel and Atty Vollan will be available at prelim tomorrow and discuss paperwork. Defendant makes threats. DA Klomberg requests security present at all future proceedings. Court agrees.
signature bond returned, defendant refused to sign

14CF318 & 14CF319 - Attorney Tienstra appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Def does not appear, incarcerated at Waupun Correctional Inst.  Court states def does qualify for Public Defender representation and SPD will appoint counsel.

1:25 - 14CF318 & 14CF319 - Defendant Cody L. Cromwell in court, in custody via video from WCI.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  without specific conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 08:15 am.
